definitions.definition: Something needed or desired; a thing of which the loss is felt.
A depression in coal strata, hollowed out before the subsequent deposition took place.
To wish for or desire (something); to feel a need or desire for; to crave or demand.
definitions.example: What do you want to eat?  I want you to leave.  I never wanted to go back to live with my mother.

definitions.definition: (in particular) To wish, desire or demand to see, have the presence of or do business with.
definitions.example: Danish police want him for embezzlement.

definitions.definition: To desire (to experience desire); to wish.
definitions.example: You can leave if you want.

definitions.definition: (usually second person, often future tense) To be advised to do something (compare should, ought).
definitions.example: You’ll want to repeat this three or four times to get the best result.

definitions.definition: (now colloquial) To lack and be in need of or require (something, such as a noun or verbal noun).
(now rare) To have occasion for (something requisite or useful); to require or need.
To be lacking or deficient or absent.
definitions.example: There was something wanting in the play.

definitions.definition: To be in a state of destitution; to be needy; to lack.
To lack and be without, to not have (something).
(by extension) To lack and (be able to) do without.
